body:
This branch can't be merged like this, because it contains commits form trunk and Min's 'cursor' branch.

Please submit for pulling  branches that only contain related commits.  If there is more than one topic to work on, each can be prepared in its own branch.  But in your feature branches, _never_ merge from trunk or any other branch, so we don't have criss-crossing merges.

I'll be happy to review it again when you submit just the standalone commits you want merged.

Thanks!

I don't have a clue, how the commits from trunk and Min's 'cursor' branch could happened...

All I do is
- hacking
- commiting
- "git pull --rebase origin $branch"
  and anything should be rebased on top of the current master of the ipython repository.

According to [1], I did it the right way, [2] looks a bit strange, but I don't know what I did wrong... :-(

Maybe you?

[1] http://github.com/ipython/ipython/network
[2] http://github.com/tomspur/ipython/network
I don't know what went wrong, but I may be able to apply it by rebasing it now... I'm working on it.

OK, there's one test failure with argparse, below. If you can fix this, go ahead and add another commit and I'll merge it. Basically if we find the system argparse, we need to match apis. This may require testing both with our argparse and the system one. But you're the one who wants unbundling, so I'm afraid you'll have to make sure it passes all tests :) 
======================================================================
ERROR: IPython.core.tests.test_run.TestMagicRunSimple.test_tclass
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.6/nose/case.py", line 183, in runTest
    self.test(*self.arg)
  File "/home/fperez/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/IPython/testing/decorators.py", line 225, in skipper_func
    return f(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/home/fperez/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/IPython/core/tests/test_run.py", line 185, in test_tclass
    tt.ipexec_validate(self.fname, out)
  File "/home/fperez/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/IPython/testing/tools.py", line 250, in ipexec_validate
    (fname, err))
ValueError: Running file '/tmp/tmp0CrCPW.ipy' produced error: '/home/fperez/usr/local/lib/python2.6/site-packages/argparse-1.1-py2.6.egg/argparse.py:1576: DeprecationWarning: The "version" argument to ArgumentParser is deprecated. Please use "add_argument(..., action=\'version\', version="N", ...)" instead\n  """instead""", DeprecationWarning)\n'

----------------------------------------------------------------------

I can't reproduce this here after updating to version 1.1, which should have the deprecation warning too...
Instead it's failing differently:

```
FAIL: IPython.core.tests.test_run.TestMagicRunSimple.test_tclass
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/nose/case.py", line 186, in runTest
    self.test(*self.arg)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/IPython/testing/decorators.py", line 225, in skipper_func
    return f(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/IPython/core/tests/test_run.py", line 169, in test_tclass
    tt.ipexec_validate(self.fname, out)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/IPython/testing/tools.py", line 252, in ipexec_validate
    nt.assert_equals(out.strip(), expected_out.strip())
AssertionError: "\x1b[?1034hARGV 1-: ['C-first']\nARGV 1-: ['C-second']\ntclass.py: deleting object: C-first" != "ARGV 1-: ['C-first']\nARGV 1-: ['C-second']\ntclass.py: deleting object: C-first"
    '"\\x1b[?1034hARGV 1-: [\'C-first\']\\nARGV 1-: [\'C-second\']\\ntclass.py: deleting object: C-first" != "ARGV 1-: [\'C-first\']\\nARGV 1-: [\'C-second\']\\ntclass.py: deleting object: C-first"' = '%s != %s' % (safe_repr("\x1b[?1034hARGV 1-: ['C-first']\nARGV 1-: ['C-second']\ntclass.py: deleting object: C-first"), safe_repr("ARGV 1-: ['C-first']\nARGV 1-: ['C-second']\ntclass.py: deleting object: C-first"))
'"\\x1b[?1034hARGV 1-: [\'C-first\']\\nARGV 1-: [\'C-second\']\\ntclass.py: deleting object: C-first" != "ARGV 1-: [\'C-first\']\\nARGV 1-: [\'C-second\']\\ntclass.py: deleting object: C-first"' = self._formatMessage('"\\x1b[?1034hARGV 1-: [\'C-first\']\\nARGV 1-: [\'C-second\']\\ntclass.py: deleting object: C-first" != "ARGV 1-: [\'C-first\']\\nARGV 1-: [\'C-second\']\\ntclass.py: deleting object: C-first"', '"\\x1b[?1034hARGV 1-: [\'C-first\']\\nARGV 1-: [\'C-second\']\\ntclass.py: deleting object: C-first" != "ARGV 1-: [\'C-first\']\\nARGV 1-: [\'C-second\']\\ntclass.py: deleting object: C-first"')
>>  raise self.failureException('"\\x1b[?1034hARGV 1-: [\'C-first\']\\nARGV 1-: [\'C-second\']\\ntclass.py:  deleting object: C-first" != "ARGV 1-: [\'C-first\']\\nARGV 1-: [\'C-second\']\\ntclass.py: deleting object: C-first"')
```

A few comments: let's separate the lib unbundling from other things you did.  I'm OK with the lib unbundling, and with the argparse update it seems it's all OK.  But in the end I think the git versioning approach you took is a bit more complex than we want to have in core code, so let's do without. It also produces awful version names in the console, which we're just not going to have:

IPython 0.11.alpha1.git.4fb9824c78bd82f839a1f741397e23c5aa3e1995.tomspur-ready_for_merge -- An enhanced Interactive Python.

Ditto for changes to make_tarball, which I've already updated elsewhere in trunk (so in fact now this branch produces a conflict).

I think the best approach will be to close this pull request and you can make a new branch where you cherrypick the unbundling changes, but do _not_ bring in any changes to anything else.  That way we can test/evaluate unbundling of externals on its own merit.

Basically the mantra is: one pull request for one single idea, no more :)

So I'm going to close this one for now.  Just make a new branch with only the unbundling commits and it should be pretty smooth.

Thanks!
